title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from deployment-related injuries or illnesses. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their families, for readjustment and recovery. The program will involve contracts with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide services in areas not adequately served by VA facilities. These contracts will require employing trained veterans, using telehealth services, participating in training programs, and complying with VA protocols. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their families. Contracts with community mental health centers and qualified entities will be used to provide services in underserved areas, requiring trained veterans, telehealth services, training programs, and compliance with VA protocols. The program includes submitting annual reports, providing clinical summary information for each veteran receiving services, and meeting other requirements as determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will contract with a national mental health organization to train veterans for peer-outreach and support services. Additionally, a training program will be conducted for clinicians to provide services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. Best practices and technologies will be utilized in the training program. The Secretary will submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation and status of the program for veterans' services, including information on the number of veterans served and types of services provided. The Secretary will submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation and status of the program for veterans' services, including evaluations of services provided and training offered.
